sources.title: UnholyLove1932 201307
sources.description: Title: Unholy Love Summary: An adaptation of Madame Bovary transported to Rye, New York in the 1930's. All characters have been renamed. Directed by: Albert Ray Actors: H.B. Warner, Lila Lee, Beryl Mercer Production Company: Albert Ray Productions Release Date: 9 June 1932 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 An adaptation of Madame Bovary transported to Rye, New York in the 1930's. All characters have been renamed.

sources.title: Unholy Love (1932) PRE-CODE HOLLYWOOD
sources.description:
Stars: H.B. Warner, Lila Lee, Beryl Mercer 
Director: Albert Ray

After young doctor marries the daughter of the family gardener, his seemingly sweet and innocent wife soon reveals her true colors and sets off a chain-reaction of tragic events. Loosely inspired by the novel Madame Bovary transported to Rye, New York circa 1930's.

metadata.Plot: Very loosely based on Madame Bovary. Jerry is a young doctor with a soft heart who is both gullible and naive. While he's trying to help heal Sheilla's ill father in their family home, his own father, Dr. Daniel Gregory, stops by and confirms there's nothing more that can be done for the patient. After Sheilla's father dies, Jerry reveals he and Sheilla are actually married and eloped without Dan knowing. Disappointed because his son married below his station and broke his engagement to his close friend's daughter, Dan leaves and tells the now ex-fiancee, Jane, what Jerry did. Though Jane is distraught, she isn't angry. Dan brings Sheilla into their family home, and she starts showing dislike for Jerry quickly, despite her much improved circumstances. He's absent a lot, trying to make enough money to move out on his own with her, and between that and Jerry's society not accepting her, Sheilla is determined to find someone who will treat her well, no matter the scandalous nature of their relationship.
metadata.Actors: H.B. Warner, Lila Lee, Beryl Mercer
